page.title: 10Almondell Country Park,E.Cdr
page.content: Almondell Country Park was opened in 1967 and is run by the West Lothian Council for Rangers. Before the park was built the Earl of Buchan owned the estate. The park has 3 rangers and needs another 2 if it is a good summer.This year has not been such a good summer but there has still been a lot of visitors down Almondell Country Park. They fish,walk dogs,play football, swim and barbecue which is the most popular activity down Almondell. There are four bridges in Almondell- one is used as a canal feeder,another is an unused railway bridge which carried shale trains.To the west of the park are the Sewage Works.Checks are made in the River Almond for pollution. There is clean water coming through into the river from the sewage outfalls. Carol-Anne and Helen
